item.title: Interesting article about Anonymous hackers
item.dc:creator: @akl akl
item.description:
@akl wrote:

Anonymous are quite good at what they do too. I was surprised at the fact considering that these guys have held themselves anonymous for so long considering with the various institutes that are after them. About 30 innocent civilians doors have been knocked down by these agencies in their pursuit to catch the “administrators” of this group.

What they do is innocuous but very effective. The wonders of this era…

UPDATE: Interesting overview of the Wikileaks threat by Palantir, HB Gary and Berico (Security firms employed to dissolve wikileaks).
http://wikileaks.ch/IMG/pdf/WikiLeaks_Response_v6.pdf

UPDATE2: Constant updates on the whole issue here; http://www.icerocket.com/search?tab=twitter&fr=h&q=hbgary&x=37&y=17

small update: CEO of Palantir cuts all ties w/ HBGary, apologizes to Glenn Greenwald, and sticks up for free speech; http://www.thetechherald.com/article.php/201106/6804/Firm-targeting-WikiLeaks-cuts-ties-with-HBGary-apologizes-to-reporter

update: Read Aaron Barr’s email account ; http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/6156166/HBGary_leaked_email
all the emails have been uploaded there

Read full topic

item.title: Interesting article about Anonymous hackers
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

I’m glad that he has learnt his place. I don’t care much for things like /b/ and the like, but anonymous is basically a group of new age hippies who are fighting for things such as free speech.
With more and more governments looking to introduce things such as internet kill switches, data retention, and censorship, the need for groups like anonymous is greater than ever.

This whole ‘national security’ thing has gone on long enough, citizens of the so-called ‘free’ world have already surrendered enough of their freedoms for what they believe to be safety.

Read full topic
